result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • David R Stone was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 22 days Huber for non-payment, consecutive to the 365 days.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Summit Police Department.
DNA previously done.

Huber with standard release conditions to commence FORTHWITH.  Sentence credit for 33 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David R Stone by phone, in custody.  Grant Scafe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendaant is requesting additional time to pay the court fines due and owing.  Court gives the defendant a payment plant of $50/month commencing November 1, 2016, alternate 22 days jail consective for failure to pay fine.  Judgment of Conviction to be amended.  Defendant to be removed from Waukesha County Collections.
Review hearing on May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Current: 2909 E. Park Ave., c/o Chippewa Valley Correctional Treatment Fac., Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States  (Effective: 05-09-2016)

dated Feb 1, 2016 response to defendatn's letter received Jan 22, 2016

ADDRESS INFO for David R Stone
Current: P.O. Box 700, c/o Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2016)
Prior: C/O Waukesha County Jail,
received Jan 22, 2016 from David Stone, regarding sentencing
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David R Stone in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Perkins does not object to the amended criminal complaint and waives formal reading.  Defendant plead guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Perkins makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following: Count #1. 

365 Days Huber concurrent with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 33 days).  Sentence commences immediately.
FINE:  $2252.00
DNA previously done. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Summit Police Department to be paid in 90 days. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 90 days .  Failure to pay; the Court orders the defendant to serve 22 days in Huber consecutive to the 365 days
DL REVOCATION:  36 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 
AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
